question.text: Arrange the number of species of phylum Arthropoda (<math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A)</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>, phylum Chordata (<math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B),</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> and phylum Mollusca (<math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C)</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> in ascending order.

solution.text: The number of species in phylum Arthropoda <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> is more than 1.3 billion because insects form the most species-rich taxonomic group (>70% of the total animals). Phylum Mollusca <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> is the second largest phylum with approximately 90000+ species. Phylum Chordata <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> has approximately 60,000 species, among which, half of the species are fishes.
